p:
Table 2 listed the results of ANOVA. The model with the larger absolute value of F and the smaller value of p was the more significant. Thus, the value of F ( F = 94.86) and p ( p < .0001) suggested that the model was significant. The value of “lack of fit” F ( F = 5.09) and the associated p ( p = .0655) was not significant, which meant that the model was accurate and applicable. The correlation coefficient ( R 2 = .9896) and adjusted correlation coefficient (
R adj 2
= 0.9791) also showed the goodness of fitting model. The coefficient of variation ( C.V.% = 3.28) reflected that the experimental values had a good reliability.
